STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 2, 2025
Tracey Compton
UPPER PENINSULA FAMILY SOLUTIONS
369 US HIGHWAY 41 E,
NEGAUNEE, MI, 49866-9624
Re: License #: CB520304693
Dear Ms. Compton:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
05/30/2025. Due to the violation of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI. 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Two of eight files reviewed each contained a PATP which documented late
signatures.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Regarding Rule 400.12326 Borrowed Home, it was recommended when
an after hours placement is to occur the agency document the verbal
2

conversation that occurred between the agency and the foster parent and the
agency and the certifying agency.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted an approved CAP on 04/03/2024 in response to those violations
established during the 2024 renewal inspection. The violations were as follows.
Rule 400.12421 Visitation and Family Time, in person contact, Rule 400.12418
Development of service plans, Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement,
FOM 722-06H Case Contacts, FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting and FOM
801-03 Medical Passport. The current Interim Inspection did not establish any
repat violations indicating that the Renewal CAP was successful in preventing
further violations.
The agency submitted a second CAP on 05/08/2025 in response to a violation of
Rule 400.12206 Staff Qualifications, established during Special Investigation
#2025SIC0000468, completed on 05/06/2025. The CAP is currently under
monitoring status.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment and Corrective Action plan were reviewed.
The assessment detailed the agency efforts to correct violations established
during the renewal inspection.
The assessment addressed barriers the agency encounters which consisted
primarily of the expectations of the job and the numbers of documents that require
completion thereby limiting worker involvement with those that they serve. The
assessment noted further that staff feel like they are unable to do their job as the
requirements are significant.
3

Financial Overview
The agency submitted an annual budget for 2025 and a certified public accountant
audit conducted in 2024. A review of the documents did not indicate any noted
financial problems.
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported liking working for the agency and they feel supported by
their supervisor and agency administration. Staff noted that the agency retains
staff as most are veteran employees and this contributes to a strong supportive
team and working environment.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern facility in Negaunee. There is sufficient office
space and technology. CHRI documents were observed to be secured as
required.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst generated two safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They are
as follows:
Safety Alert 1. A safety alert was generated on 02/06/2025 as the home was missing a
smoke alarm between the master bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: A smoke alarm was installed on 02/06/205 in the required area and photos
of the installed alarm were provided.
Safety Alert 2. A safety alert was generated on 02/28/2025 as the home did not have a
smoke alarm between the children's basement bedroom and the rest of the home. The
home was also missing an alarm between the upstairs bedroom and the rest of the
home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 3-3-3025 as the alarms were installed and
photos provided.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
June 2, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
6/2/2025

Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
